top_categories.workout_context: Dusty Bandita’s montana mountains, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Dusty Bandita rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Dusty Bandita isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Dusty Bandita when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Dusty Bandita’s montana mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dusty Bandita. Make this intensity feel like home.
The varied gradients at Dusty Bandita reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Dusty Bandita — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Dusty Bandita’s montana mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Dusty Bandita intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Dusty Bandita — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Dusty Bandita count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Dusty Bandita’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Dusty Bandita. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dusty Bandita requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on montana mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: montana mountains, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of montana mountain gravel in Ovando, Montana.
